text:
Nice place to vibe!
Staff are friendly, I even asked them about what IEM upgrade to get from my current ones and they instantly gave an option for me to try.

If you're an audio nerd who wants to play around with different IEMs, this is definitely the place to visit!
This place is an audiophile's playground. The staff are super chill and knowledgeable. You are sure to get something that fits your taste. Wish I lived in Singapore to crash here on the daily!

Smaller than I expected/had seen on YouTube. But the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The only gear I saw was on the wall as pictured, there didn't appear to be any keebs/additional headphones available to try as other reviews have pictured.

Unfortunately the item I walked in to buy was only available for purchase online which was a shame but I did try listening to some of their beans + purchased a cable in the end. Good experience overall.

Just to note: I did send them an email ahead of time regarding some IEMs I was interested in purchasing and weeks later they still haven't replied. I changed my mind regarding the purchase in the end so it's not a big deal but I thought it was worth mentioning.

I was recommended by friends who are passionate about the IEM world to visit The Hangout. And I do recommend others who’s interested to visit the place and try out their IEM’s on display! Staff is super cool, chill and informative about the different sets of IEM’s. There’s no cost to try them out and gain some of the experience.
I should have taken more photos but I was too shy.

HELLA satisfied with my Delci! Super chill, staff is always super helpful. Spent 5 hours trying out pretty much all the IEMS in the 80 ~ 250 sgd bracket. Love how staff was pushing me to stay in my initial budget when I found IEMs I liked which were 2 to 3 times of my budget (hehe oops). In the end, I settled the one I kept gravitating more and suited my comfort/budget best!

I'll be spending months thinking about the Odyssey now that I got a taste of meta tuning...
